intro: Hermannia secundiflora, commonly known as the red-flowered hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a glossy surface. Hermannia secundiflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
